intro: Ulmus minor subsp. procera, commonly known as the tall field elm, is a subspecies of the field elm native to Europe. It is a deciduous tree that typically grows to heights of 10–20 meters, characterized by its straight trunk and broad, spreading crown. The leaves are ovate to elliptic, with serrated margins and a dark green upper surface. It produces small, pendulous clusters of yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged samaras for seed dispersal. This subspecies is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
